Text: Re R memory problems Cc PST Cornelia Schratz wrote Dear all I want to increase the memory of R it is to small for my large data set However I find only instructions for UNIX Could somebody write me how to increase the memory for R running on WinNT please See the R for Windows FAQ section or Memory On Windows the maxmemsize option sets the maximum memory allocation it has a minimum allowed value of M This is intended to catch attempts to allocate excessive amounts of memory which may cause other processes to run out of resources The default is the smaller of the amount of physical RAM in the machine and Mb See also memorylimit Uwe rhelp mailing list Read hornikRRFAQhtml Send info help or unsubscribe in the body not the subject To

Re R Subsetting data frames without a loop Cc PST MichaelNielsenSyd wrote I KNOW this should be easy but Im stuck My data frame consists of multiple observations from each of a number of stations and what I would like to do is create another data frame that contains all the variables of the first but only rows where a certain variable is at its maximum for the station So for example mydf stn obs v tapplyvfactorstnmax so my new data frame should contain possibly multiple rows per station stn obs v As a first idea mydftapplyvfactorstn functionx whichvmaxx Uwe rhelp mailing list Read hornikRRFAQhtml Send info help or unsubscribe in the body not the subject To
